meanings.definition: A series of four related literary or operatic works.
meanings.sent1: The author completed his tetralogy with the final book.
meanings.sent2: The tetralogy of novels told the story of a young wizard.
meanings.sent3: The tetralogy of detective novels kept readers guessing until the very end.
meanings.sent4: Her tetralogy of plays explored themes of love and betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The tetralogy of poems painted a vivid picture of nature's beauty.

meanings.definition: A group of four related medical symptoms or conditions.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with a rare tetralogy of symptoms.
meanings.sent2: The medical team identified a tetralogy of heart defects in the newborn.
meanings.sent3: The tetralogy of ailments puzzled even the most experienced physicians.
meanings.sent4: His tetralogy of symptoms made it challenging to pinpoint the exact cause.
meanings.sent5: The patient's unusual tetralogy of conditions required specialized treatment.

meanings.definition: A set of four related elements or components.
meanings.sent1: The engineer designed a tetralogy of gears for the machine.
meanings.sent2: The puzzle consisted of a tetralogy of interconnected pieces.
meanings.sent3: The tetralogy of colors in the painting created a harmonious blend.
meanings.sent4: Each tetralogy of buttons on the remote controlled a different function.
meanings.sent5: The artist's tetralogy of shapes formed a captivating pattern.
